message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user wants me to respond to a survey about AI in education as a New Zealand primary or secondary school teacher. I need to provide responses to 10 statements about AI, each with one of these options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'.

Let me think about reasonable responses from a teacher's perspective:

TT4G35A - "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans." - This is generally true, AI tools can assist with lesson planning. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35B - "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities." - AI can help with differentiation and personalization. This is a reasonable capability. "Agree"

TT4G35C - "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually." - AI can provide personalized support, adaptive learning, etc. "Agree"

TT4G35D - "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs)." - AI has potential to support diverse learners. "Agree"

TT4G35E - "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks." - This is quite true - AI can help with grading, attendance, scheduling, etc. "Strongly agree"

TT4G35F - "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own." - This is a legitimate concern about academic integrity. "Agree"

TT4G35G - "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct." - This is a valid concern; AI systems can make errors. "Agree"

TT4G35H - "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions." - This is a known concern about AI systems. "Agree"

TT4G35I - "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data." - This is a legitimate concern about data handling. "Agree"
 
TT4G35J - "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students." - AI systems could recommend teaching methods that don't fit the classroom context or student needs if not properly trained. "Agree"

I'm aiming for responses that acknowledge both the genuine benefits AI offers for teaching and learning, as well as the real risks and limitations that educators should be aware of.
